title: Local tolerance study of the VA-MENGOC-BC® antimeningococcal vaccine in Sprague Dawley rats. Evaluation at 24 and 36 months of shelf
author: Reynaldo Oliva-HernÃndez; Mildrey Fariþas-Medina; Juan F Infante-Bourzac; Tamara HernÃndez-Salazar; Darcy Nºþez-MartÚnez; Alex Quintero-PÕrez; Concepciµn Campa-Huergo; Gustavo Sierra-GonzÃlez
cleaned_text: 2019, Number 1 VacciMonitor 2019; 28 (1) Local tolerance study VA-MENGOC-BC® antimeningococcal vaccine in Sprague Dawley rats. Evaluation Meningococcal continues to be a health problem in different countries and different vaccines have been obtained for the prevention of this disease. VA-MENGOC-BCÛ vaccine has been effective and safe in the prevention of meningococcal meningitis against serogroups B and C. This has shown good stability over time without changing its quality as a product; It was stored on a shelf for 24 and 36 months at temperatures of 4 to 8 ¤C. Their possible toxicological potential was evaluated Dawley rats. Immunized animals toxicity or deaths were observed. No differences were found between the experimental groups in terms of body weight, water and food consumption, no fever or local irritability evident. Anatomopathologically no lesions of that the VA-MENGOC-BCÛ vaccine that remained on the shelf for 24 and 36 months did not show any local or systemic effects in rats.
